column1: The Medina Province (Arabic: مِنْطَقَة ٱلْمَدِيْنَة ٱلْمُنَوَّرَة‎
column2: romanized: Minṭaqat Al-Madīnah Al-Munawarah) is a province (minṭaqah) of Saudi Arabia
column3: located on the country's western side
column4: along the Red Sea coast. It has an area of 151
column6: 680 sq mi) and a population of 2

column2: the second holiest city in Islam. Other cities in the province include Yanbu' al Bahr and Badr Hunayn. It also contains Mada'in Saleh
